title: Noam Chomsky - 2007-04-06 - Interview on the Vietnam and Iraq Wars - Circa1 Media - Improved Sound
description:
Be sure to pick 720p for best sound/video quality. 

On April 6, 2007, Noam Chomsky was interviewed in his office at MIT by journalists from Circa1 Media.  They discuss cases of self-immolation from the Vietnam and then ongoing 2nd Iraq War, among other matters.


For the video, I corrected the aspect ratio, which was far too narrow.

I gave the sound a de-noising with digital noise reduction to eliminate a persistent hiss/hum than ran throughout the recording.  It came out sounding very clear, with a very low noise floor.



Thanks to @circa1media https://www.youtube.com/@circa1media/featured for the upload:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=56OWdXTgS8U




Tags:


Chomsky, 2007, September 11, 9-11, 911, Anthrax Attacks, 1993 World Trade Center Bombing, anti-war movement, Vietnam War, John Kennedy, Iraq War, Arthur Schlesinger, Bernard Fall, Robert Fisk, Patrick Cockburn, Fallujah, Iran, Nicaragua, George III, Thomas Jefferson, Anthony Lewis, Tet Offensive, Norman R. Morrison, Women's Movement, Malachi Ritscher, Weathermen, Alberto Gonzales, Military Commissions Act, War Crimes Act,
